title: Introduction to Python
description: Get started with Python basics, installation, and running your first code in a Jupyter notebook environment.

content.introduction: Python is a versatile and beginner-friendly programming language widely used in cognitive science research, data analysis, and machine learning. In this lesson, you'll learn the basics of Python and start writing your first programs.

sections.title: What is Python?
sections.content: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its readability and ease of use. It supports multiple programming paradigms and has a comprehensive standard library.

sections.title: Setting Up Your Environment
sections.content: We recommend using Anaconda, a distribution of Python that includes many scientific packages. You can download it from the Anaconda website and follow the installation instructions for your operating system.

sections.title: Jupyter Notebooks
sections.content: Jupyter notebooks provide an interactive environment where you can write and execute code, visualize data, and document your work. To start a Jupyter notebook, open Anaconda Navigator and click on the Jupyter Notebook icon.

sections.title: Basic Syntax
sections.content:
Python syntax is designed to be readable and straightforward. Here are some basic examples: 

```python
# This is a comment
print('Hello, World!') # This prints text

# Variables
x = 5
name = 'Python'

# Basic operations
sum = x + 10
greeting = 'Hello, ' + name
```

sections.title: Running Your First Program
sections.content:
Let's write a simple program that asks for your name and responds with a greeting: 

```python
name = input('What is your name? ')
print(f'Hello, {name}! Welcome to Python for Cognitive Science!')
```

content.summary: In this lesson, you've learned what Python is, how to set up your development environment, and how to write and run basic Python code. You're now ready to explore more complex Python concepts in the upcoming lessons.

title: Data Types and Variables

content.introduction: Understanding data types and variables is fundamental to programming in Python. This lesson covers the main data types you'll use in cognitive science research and data analysis.

title: Control Flow

title: Functions and Modules
description: Create reusable code with functions and organize your programs using Python modules.
